reviewText: I used to play this game way back 8-9 years ago, facebook didn't even existed and I lived in a country where there was only 4 hours of schooltime unlike in the US. I had all the time in the world to play this game competitively but not anymore.\n\nThis is a Pay 2 Win game, you have to observe your empire at all time moving resourses away from enemy attacks, having fortresses filled with archers and your main army constantly attacking satellite abandoned empire because if you leave them in your home you wake up finding them all dead and it can take you another week to rebuild them back while your enemy has an extra week ahead of you. You have the option of buying $ a 10 hour of your resources production. Still the same, only a few thing has changed. If you don't have a life this is a good game, otherwise treat it as a farmville empire game.

reviewText:
TL;DR:

3 years ago I had the misfortune to work for the company that produces this piece of ****. It was complete garbage back then, it is complete garbage now

Detailed Review:

- It is extremely expensie pay to win
- It is pure pay to win, there is absolutely NO skill involved
- It requires insane time investment, that is the only way to offset the pay to win aspect
- it is insanely overdesigned and deliberately obfuscates valuable information. The purpose is so it looks deep. It is not deep, it just hides information from the player
- All monetization methods are borderline unethical. This software is closer to virtual gambling casino than a game
- It has innumerable game breaking bugs, that will cost you time and money. Even the TUTORIAL is broken!
- It has numerous unethical practices, For example forcing (not asking, forcing) its employees to like the game in AppStore, youtube, Steam. So you know where the possitive reviews come from.
- Another unethical practice - bullshoting. For example its trailer has elements that has nothing to do with the actual gameplay. It is subtly lying to you
- The game is completely unfair PvP - every day your resources will be robbed by much stronger players and your army killed. Only way to prevent this is to be canstantly online

Conclusion - this is THE WORST piece the gaming industry has to offer. This game is what you would get, if the creators of farmville were greedier but also complete morons

reviewText:
Product received for free

I played this game years back, around 5 or so years, I played for around 2 years, and the game was somewhat fun, SOMEWHAT fun. I liked building up a tiny nation, with a good army and all that, and I was close to getting my first ever colony.
Then I was constantly raided by people, and that's when I quit the game.

Over these 5 years, the 'game' has shown no improvement, in fact it's shown the opposite. The 'game' has 1 terrible update that I NEED to mention

If you have 5 times more, or less points then another player, you can't attack them. This sounds like a good solution to fix weak players being raided by stronger players right? Wrong, I still get raided by stronger players that have 2 times as many points as I do, and I end up getting raided, loosing battles because the combat is ♥♥♥♥ing terrible, and I end up quitting the 'realm'. I can't even find targets to raid so I can make back my resources, it comes down to who has more units" for the combat system. It comes down to Big players raid medium players
date: causing medium players to raid small players
recommended: and small players (like me) have no one to raid becuase every one is below 200 points
hoursPlayed:
or is too high up.

To sum it all up
Don't play this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t Pay-to-Win Freemium browser based piece of ♥♥♥♥ 'game'.
How the ♥♥♥♥ did this game get on steam?
How? Seriously

reviewText: This is honestly not bad for a browser game and costing $0. It has an interesting dynasty mechanic which is more than I could say for Rome 2 Total War when it was first released and I wasted $50 on. It also has a fun and somewhat believable market system and decent visualized battle calculation which is more than I can say for Grand Ages Medieval on which I also wasted another $50. The reason I thumb this down is because it belongs on my browser. NOT on STEAM where it insults quality games such as Crusader Kings 2 by even being listed here.

reviewText:
Ok, so after now testing the game for a bit, I thought I should review, so other that loves this genre will stay away from this piece of crap :P (Ive played a ton of games in this genre, both casual and hardcore. For example evony, known to be quite p2w, doesnt even compare to this when it comes to p2w.)


Cons:

- Tutorial is a pain, no choice to do it on your own
- There is no do you really want to" message when using paid currency
- The learning curve is huge
recommended: but rather because its badly documented ..\n- Speedups etc. is REALLY unbalanced! Paying vs free players is so big that this game become unplayable\n- Upgrading buildings feels kinda pointless
hoursPlayed:
when you have the resource buildings to 10 its practically 100% about making an army ...

Pros

- Great music! (Theres none)
- The combat works quite well
- Range and movement speed feels balanced


Personal conclusion:

A free player wont stand a chance due to how unbalanced this game is. I.e. I as a free player and active from the start of the server has about 10k points. A paying player that defeated me had over 100k points ;) Making it practically impossible to fight back :P Supposedly theres a system to avoid players 5x stronger than you from attacking
voteText: but can't really say that worked here either. Anyways a paid player can be in first place and 4x as strong as the second place if he is willing to pay for it
